Key Match Events: The match was abandoned due to heavy rain, with South Africa 13 runs away from their rain-affected Duckworth-Lewis target of 64 from seven overs.
Zimbabwe quick Richard Ngarava was injured after slipping over in the wet conditions and had to come off the field.
South Africa opener Quinton de Kock smashed a blistering 47 from 18 balls to almost get his team across the line.
Post-Match Reflections: Zimbabwe coach David Houghton criticised the call to try to play on as the rain was 'ridiculous' and the conditions were difficult for both sides.
South Africa coach Mark Boucher said the conditions were tough but teams had to live with the decisions of the officials.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The result leaves South Africa one point behind India and Bangladesh after the opening round, with only two countries progressing to the semi-finals.
Zimbabwe earlier posted 5-79 from a reduced nine overs, after showers pushed back the start of play.
